page.title: 09Farming around Maylandsea
page.content: {Farms}are family owned and run. Size varies from 50 hectares to 220 hectares but they have common features{.Vegetable}producing nurseries are declining. There is a large garden centre and a mushroom farm.{Crops}are Autumn drilled. Wheat is the main cereal followed by barley. Rape, maize field peas and new-lay hay also grown.{Straw}mostly baled and used for bedding or fodder. Stubble burnt as incoporation into heavy land is a costly inefficient process. {Heavy land}predominantly clay. Most fields near coastline have been drained. Where{livestock}are kept it is beef cattle bought in as calves or stores to finish. The number kept varies from 60 to 400.
